intent.description: Payment intent. Must be set to sale for immediate payment, authorize to authorize a payment for capture later, or order to create an order.

payment_method.description: Payment method used. Must be either credit_card or paypal.

funding_instruments.description: A list of funding instruments for the current payment

funding_instruments_credit_card.json.title: Credit card funding instrument
funding_instruments_credit_card.json.description: PayPal credit card funding instrument json schema

number.description: Credit card number. Numeric characters only with no spaces or punctuation. The string must conform with modulo and length required by each credit card type.

type.description: Credit card type. Valid types are: visa, mastercard, discover, amex

expire_month.description: Expiration month with no leading zero. Acceptable values are 1 through 12.

state.description: Cardholder’s last name.State of the credit card funding instrument: expired or ok. Value generated by PayPal.

valid_until.description: Funding instrument expiration date. Value generated by PayPal.

line1.description: Line 1 of the address (e.g., Number, street, etc). 100 characters max

line2.description: Line 2 of the address (e.g., Suite, apt #, etc). 100 characters max.

postal_code.description: Zip code or equivalent is usually required for countries that have them. 20 characters max. Required in certain countries.

state.description: 2-letter code for US states, and the equivalent for other countries. 100 characters max.

funding_instruments_stored_credit_card.j.title: Stored credit card funding instrument
funding_instruments_stored_credit_card.j.description: PayPal stored credit card funding instrument json schema

id.description: ID of the credit card. This ID is provided in the response when storing credit cards.

payer_id.description: A unique identifier that you can assign and track when storing a credit card or using a stored credit card. This ID can help to avoid unintentional use or misuse of credit cards. This ID can be any value you would like to associate with the saved card, such as a UUID, username, or email address. Required when using a stored credit card if a payer_id was originally provided when storing the credit card in vault.

number.description: Credit card number. Numeric characters only with no spaces or punctuation. The string must conform with modulo and length required by each credit card type.

type.description: Credit card type. Valid types are: visa, mastercard, discover, amex

expire_month.description: Expiration month with no leading zero. Acceptable values are 1 through 12.

state.description: Cardholder’s last name.State of the credit card funding instrument: expired or ok. Value generated by PayPal.

valid_until.description: Funding instrument expiration date. Value generated by PayPal.

funding_instruments_credit_card_token.js.title: Credit card token funding instrument
funding_instruments_credit_card_token.js.description: PayPal credit card token funding instrument json schema

credit_card_id.description: ID of credit card previously stored using /vault/credit-card

payer_id.description: A unique identifier that you can assign and track when storing a credit card or using a stored credit card. This ID can help to avoid unintentional use or misuse of credit cards. This ID can be any value you would like to associate with the saved card, such as a UUID, username, or email address. Required when using a stored credit card if a payer_id was originally provided when storing the credit card in vault.

last4.description: Last four digits of the stored credit card number. Value generated by PayPal.

type.description: Credit card type. Valid types are: visa, mastercard, discover, amex. Values are presented in lowercase and not should not be used for display. Value generated by PayPal.

expire_year.description: 4-digit expiration year. Value generated by PayPal.

expire_month.description: Expiration month with no leading zero. Acceptable values are 1 through 12. Value generated by PayPal.

email.description: Email address representing the payer. 127 characters max.

first_name.description: First name of the payer. Value generated by PayPal.

last_name.description: Last name of the payer. Vaelue gnerated by PayPal.

payer_id.description: PayPal assigned Payer ID. Vaelue gnerated by PayPal.

phone.description: Phone number representing the payer. 20 characters max.

recipient_name.description: Name of the recipient at this address. 50 characters max.

type.description: Address type. Must be one of the following: residential, business, or mailbox.

line1.description: Line 1 of the address (e.g., Number, street, etc). 100 characters max.

line2.description: Line 2 of the address (e.g., Suite, apt #, etc). 100 characters max.

postal_code.description: Zip code or equivalent is usually required for countries that have them. 20 characters max.

state.description: 2-letter code for US states, and the equivalent for other countries. 100 characters max.

phone.description: Phone number in E.123 format. 50 characters max.

related_resources.description: Financial transactions related to a payment.

currency.description: 3-letter currency code. PayPal does not support all currencies.

total.description: Total amount charged from the payer to the payee. In case of a refund, this is the refunded amount to the original payer from the payee. 10 characters max with support for 2 decimal places.

quantity.description: Number of a particular item. 10 characters max.

sku.description: Stock keeping unit corresponding (SKU) to item. 50 characters max.

return_url.description: The payer is redirected to this URL after approving the payment.

cancel_url.description: The payer is redirected to this URL after canceling the payment.
